Junior Account Officer Job at HTSF Global Limited




        
    

        
        HTSF Global Limited is a leading company dedicated to revolutionizing the agricultural and grocery shopping experience through our innovative e-commerce marketplace. HTSF Global was founded with a clear vision: to transform the Agriculture sector by delivering excellence in goods and services through technology. Our story began with Ayodeji Enitan's firsthand experience of the challenges in Agriculture, igniting a passion for creating meaningful change.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Account Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are urgently hiring a Junior Account Officer. As our Account Officer, you will oversee daily financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and contribute to the company’s financial strategy.
	You’ll play a key role in managing accounting transactions, budgets, payroll, and accurate financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Handle accounts payable/receivable and bank reconciliations
	Oversee monthly payroll scheduling and salary disbursement for all staff
	Ensure compliance with statutory payments and filings (FIRS, PENCOM, ITF, NSITF, etc.)
	Prepare budgets, forecasts, and cash flow statements
	Support audits and liaise with external auditors
	Advise management on financial risks and opportunities
	Implement and maintain accounting systems and internal controls


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years proven experience in a similar role
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books) and MS Excel
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Integrity, discretion, and a detail-oriented mindset


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Opportunity for growth in a technology-driven organization
	Supportive and collaborative work environment

Sales Representative Job at Rifugio Communications Limited




        
    

        
        Rifugio Communications Ltd is a registered partner to Samsung and other global mobile device brands in Nigeria. We operate a chain of Samsung Experience Stores and Rifugio Brand stores, which provide an array of warranty protected Mobile devices and accessories at the best prices, across Nigeria. We offer mobile hardware required to house bespoke Sales Force Automation and Mobile Device Management solutions (Samsung Knox) to organizations. We offer Laptops, printers (inclusive of mobile and portable printers), printing consumables such as ink and toners, as well as other types of IT equipment.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative
Job Locations: Ikeja, Alapere (Ketu) and Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage in-store retail activities
	Provide customer service and enhanced customer experience.
	Assess customers’ needs and provide matching products and services.
	Demonstrate sound product and service knowledge always.
	Keep up with fluctuating supply and demand, as well as price trends
	Understand/monitor local competitors and communicate business intelligence.
	Identify, introduce and penetrate new prospects and other sales opportunities.
	Handle customer queries and complaints effectively.
	Perform direct marketing and sales activities as well as coordinate periodic promotional activities.
	Generate B2B, corporate and bulk/wholesale sales where feasible.
	Identify current and future trends that appeal to consumers.
	Monitor and report all other activities and provide relevant information for the management.
	Produce daily and weekly reports.
	Stock and inventory management


Specification


	At least a University Degree
	Experience in sales of mobile communication devices or household appliances is mandatory
	Proficiency in MS Office
	High numeracy skills
	Strong attention to detail
	Strong negotiation skills
	Good written oral and communication skills
	Good presentation skills
	Good interpersonal and relationship management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Ability to use own initiative.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV as an attachment to: hr@rifugionigeria.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

Note


	Candidates should clearly indicate their locationson their CVs. For example: "Ikeja, Lagos".
	Preference will be given to candidates who live not too far fromoutlets where there are vacant positions.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Fresh graduates (must have completed NYSC) who live close to outlets where there are vacant positions will also be considered.

  "description": "At Nexcore Advisory Services Limited, we believe that every journey is unique. Our name, &quot;Nexcore,&quot; symbolizes the connection between where you are now and where you want to be. Nexcore aims to be the first tech-driven immigration advisory startup in Nigeria, revolutionizing the industry by integrating innovative technology solutions with personalized client support. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager

Job Summary


	The Human Resources Manager will oversee all aspects of HR management at Uncle Stan&rsquo;s Foods, ensuring the efficient implementation of HR policies, employee engagement, compliance with labour laws, and the alignment of workforce planning with the company&rsquo;s operational and growth objectives.
	This role requires a proactive leader capable of handling multi-outlet staff needs in a fast-paced quick service restaurant (QSR) environment.


Key Responsibilities
Recruitment &amp; Onboarding:


	Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract qualified candidates.
	Oversee end-to-end hiring processes, including job postings, interviews, selection, and background/guarantor checks.
	Ensure new employees undergo structured onboarding and orientation programs.
	Maintain a talent pipeline for critical positions.


Employee Relations &amp; Engagement:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for employee concerns and grievances.
	Promote a positive workplace culture across all outlets.
	Organise staff welfare activities, recognition programs, and engagement initiatives to improve morale.
	Address misconduct and conflicts promptly while ensuring fair and consistent disciplinary action.


Policy Development &amp; Compliance:


	Develop, review, and enforce HR policies in line with Nigerian labour laws and QSR industry best practices.
	Ensure all branches comply with company rules, labour laws, and health &amp; safety regulations.
	Keep management updated on changes in employment legislation.


Performance Management:


	Coordinate the company&rsquo;s performance appraisal process.
	Collaborate with department heads to set Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for all roles.
	Monitor and evaluate employee performance, providing guidance for improvement.


Training &amp; Development:


	Conduct training needs analysis for all departments.
	Organise periodic training sessions for customer service, food safety, leadership, and compliance.
	Develop career development plans for high-potential employees.


HR Administration:


	Maintain accurate HR records, personnel files, and HRIS data.
	Manage staff attendance, leave requests, and absenteeism reports.
	Oversee payroll inputs and staff benefits administration.
	Ensure proper documentation of all HR actions and decisions.


Workforce Planning &amp; Retention


	Forecast staffing needs for new and existing outlets.
	Develop retention strategies to reduce staff turnover.
	Identify and groom internal talent for leadership roles.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Staff turnover rate maintained within company targets.
	Recruitment cycle time (vacancy to hire) kept within agreed limits.
	100% compliance with company policies and labour regulations.
	Timely completion of performance appraisals.
	Improved employee engagement scores.
	Reduction in disciplinary cases due to proactive staff management.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	Minimum of&nbsp;5 years of HR management experience, preferably in the QSR, retail, or hospitality sector.
	Professional HR certification (CIPM, SHRM, or equivalent) is an advantage.
	Strong understanding of Nigerian labour laws and HR best practices.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and conflict-resolution skills.
	Proficiency in HRIS and Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced, multi-location operation.


Working Conditions


	Based at Head Office but with periodic visits to outlets for HR supervision.
	Fast-paced QSR environment requiring flexibility, responsiveness, and people skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrunclestansfoods@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant / Cost Accountant",
  "description": "Afripoint Group Limited is a dynamic and innovation-driven organization delivering cutting-edge technology and enterprise solutions across industries. We&#39;re on a mission to redefine systems and experiences, and we&rsquo;re looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Cost Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Onsite)
Department: Finance &amp; Accounts
Reports To: Finance Manager / Head of Accounts

About the Role


	Afripoint Group is seeking a detail-oriented and results-driven Accountant / Cost Accountant to join our Finance team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing all accounting functions, preparing financial reports, monitoring costs, supporting budgeting and forecasting processes, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations and internal control systems.
	This role requires a professional who is ICAN certified, possesses excellent analytical skills, and demonstrates a strong understanding of cost management and financial reporting principles.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate and timely financial records in accordance with IFRS and company policies.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Support audit activities by providing relevant data and documentation.
	Ensure timely posting and reconciliation of all financial transactions.


Cost Accounting &amp; Analysis:


	Develop and implement cost control systems to monitor production, operating, and overhead costs.
	Conduct variance analysis between actual and standard costs, and recommend corrective actions.
	Analyze cost trends and prepare detailed cost reports for management decision-making.
	Participate in periodic inventory valuation and stock reconciliations.


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting:


	Assist in preparing and monitoring budgets across departments.
	Review financial performance against budget and provide variance explanations.
	Provide data-driven insights to improve cost efficiency and profitability.


Taxation &amp; Compliance:


	Ensure accurate computation and timely remittance of taxes (PAYE, VAT, WHT, CIT, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with all financial, statutory, and internal control regulations.
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and regulatory agencies as required.


Financial Controls &amp; Systems:


	Enforce internal control policies to safeguard company assets.
	Support implementation and maintenance of accounting software and ERP systems.
	Recommend and implement process improvements for greater accuracy and efficiency.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years relevant experience in accounting, cost accounting, or financial management roles.
	ICAN Certification (fully qualified) &mdash; mandatory.
	Strong understanding of IFRS, Nigerian tax laws, and cost control principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Financial and cost analysis
	Budgeting and forecasting
	Internal control and compliance
	Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
	Professional ethics and confidentiality.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation package
	Opportunities for professional growth and development
	A dynamic and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;hr@afripointgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Accountant / Cost Accountant Job at Afripoint Group Limited




        
    

        
        Afripoint Group Limited is a dynamic and innovation-driven organization delivering cutting-edge technology and enterprise solutions across industries. We're on a mission to redefine systems and experiences, and we’re looking for exceptional talent to grow with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Cost Accountant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Onsite)
Department: Finance & Accounts
Reports To: Finance Manager / Head of Accounts

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Afripoint Group is seeking a detail-oriented and results-driven Accountant / Cost Accountant to join our Finance team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing all accounting functions, preparing financial reports, monitoring costs, supporting budgeting and forecasting processes, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations and internal control systems.
	This role requires a professional who is ICAN certified, possesses excellent analytical skills, and demonstrates a strong understanding of cost management and financial reporting principles.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Accounting & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate and timely financial records in accordance with IFRS and company policies.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Support audit activities by providing relevant data and documentation.
	Ensure timely posting and reconciliation of all financial transactions.


Cost Accounting & Analysis:


	Develop and implement cost control systems to monitor production, operating, and overhead costs.
	Conduct variance analysis between actual and standard costs, and recommend corrective actions.
	Analyze cost trends and prepare detailed cost reports for management decision-making.
	Participate in periodic inventory valuation and stock reconciliations.


Budgeting & Forecasting:


	Assist in preparing and monitoring budgets across departments.
	Review financial performance against budget and provide variance explanations.
	Provide data-driven insights to improve cost efficiency and profitability.


Taxation & Compliance:


	Ensure accurate computation and timely remittance of taxes (PAYE, VAT, WHT, CIT, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with all financial, statutory, and internal control regulations.
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and regulatory agencies as required.


Financial Controls & Systems:


	Enforce internal control policies to safeguard company assets.
	Support implementation and maintenance of accounting software and ERP systems.
	Recommend and implement process improvements for greater accuracy and efficiency.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related discipline.
	Minimum of 3–5 years relevant experience in accounting, cost accounting, or financial management roles.
	ICAN Certification (fully qualified) — mandatory.
	Strong understanding of IFRS, Nigerian tax laws, and cost control principles.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., Sage, QuickBooks, SAP).
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	High level of integrity, accuracy, and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Financial and cost analysis
	Budgeting and forecasting
	Internal control and compliance
	Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
	Professional ethics and confidentiality.


What We Offer


	Competitive compensation package
	Opportunities for professional growth and development
	A dynamic and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr@afripointgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
